verses.verse: Through desire <WH8378> a man, having separated <WH6504> <WH8737> himself, seeketh <WH1245> <WH8762> and intermeddleth <WH1566> <WH8691> with all wisdom <WH8454>.
A fool <WH3684> hath no delight <WH2654> <WH8799> in understanding <WH8394>, but that his heart <WH3820> may discover <WH1540> <WH8692> itself.
When the wicked <WH7563> cometh <WH935> <WH8800>, then cometh <WH935> <WH8804> also contempt <WH937>, and with ignominy <WH7036> reproach <WH2781>.
The words <WH1697> of a man's <WH376> mouth <WH6310> are as deep <WH6013> waters <WH4325>, and the wellspring <WH4726> of wisdom <WH2451> as a flowing <WH5042> <WH8802> brook <WH5158>.
It is not good <WH2896> to accept <WH5375> <WH8800> the person <WH6440> of the wicked <WH7563>, to overthrow <WH5186> <WH8687> the righteous <WH6662> in judgment <WH4941>.
A fool's <WH3684> lips <WH8193> enter <WH935> <WH8799> into contention <WH7379>, and his mouth <WH6310> calleth <WH7121> <WH8799> for strokes <WH4112>.
A fool's <WH3684> mouth <WH6310> is his destruction <WH4288>, and his lips <WH8193> are the snare <WH4170> of his soul <WH5315>.
The words <WH1697> of a talebearer <WH5372> are as wounds <WH3859> <WH8693>, and they go down <WH3381> <WH8804> into the innermost parts <WH2315> of the belly <WH990>.
He also that is slothful <WH7503> <WH8693> in his work <WH4399> is brother <WH251> to him that is a great <WH1167> waster <WH7843> <WH8688>.
The name <WH8034> of the YY <WH3068> is a strong <WH5797> tower <WH4026>: the righteous <WH6662> runneth <WH7323> <WH8799> into it, and is safe <WH7682> <WH8738>.
The rich man's <WH6223> wealth <WH1952> is his strong <WH5797> city <WH7151>, and as an high <WH7682> <WH8737> wall <WH2346> in his own conceit <WH4906>.
Before <WH6440> destruction <WH7667> the heart <WH3820> of man <WH376> is haughty <WH1361> <WH8799>, and before <WH6440> honour <WH3519> is humility <WH6038>.
He that answereth <WH7725> <WH8688> a matter <WH1697> before he heareth <WH8085> <WH8799> it, it is folly <WH200> and shame <WH3639> unto him.
The spirit <WH7307> of a man <WH376> will sustain <WH3557> <WH8770> his infirmity <WH4245>; but a wounded <WH5218> spirit <WH7307> who can bear <WH5375> <WH8799> ?
The heart <WH3820> of the prudent <WH995> <WH8737> getteth <WH7069> <WH8799> knowledge <WH1847>; and the ear <WH241> of the wise <WH2450> seeketh <WH1245> <WH8762> knowledge <WH1847>.
A man's <WH120> gift <WH4976> maketh room <WH7337> <WH8686> for him, and bringeth <WH5148> <WH8686> him before <WH6440> great men <WH1419>.
He that is first <WH7223> in his own cause <WH7379> seemeth just <WH6662>; but his neighbour <WH7453> cometh <WH935> <WH8804> <WH8675> <WH935> <WH8799> and searcheth <WH2713> <WH8804> him.
The lot <WH1486> causeht contentions <WH4079> to cease <WH7673> <WH8686>, and parteth <WH6504> <WH8686> between the mighty <WH6099>.
A brother <WH251> offended <WH6586> <WH8737> is harder to be won than a strong <WH5797> city <WH7151>: and their contentions <WH4079> <WH8675> <WH4066> are like the bars <WH1280> of a castle <WH759>.

A man's <WH376> belly <WH990> shall be satisfied <WH7646> <WH8799> with the fruit <WH6529> of his mouth <WH6310>; and with the increase <WH8393> of his lips <WH8193> shall he be filled <WH7646> <WH8799>.
Death <WH4194> and life <WH2416> are in the power <WH3027> of the tongue <WH3956>: and they that love <WH157> <WH8802> it shall eat <WH398> <WH8799> the fruit <WH6529> thereof.
Whoso findeth <WH4672> <WH8804> a wife <WH802> findeth <WH4672> <WH8804> a good <WH2896> thing, and obtaineth <WH6329> <WH8686> favour <WH7522> of the YY <WH3068>.
The poor <WH7326> <WH8802> useht <WH1696> <WH8762> intreaties <WH8469>; but the rich <WH6223> answereth <WH6030> <WH8799> roughly <WH5794>.
A man <WH376> that hath friends <WH7453> must shew himself friendly <WH7489> <WH8710>: and there is <WH3426> a friend <WH157> <WH8802> that sticketh closer <WH1695> than a brother <WH251>.
